notes: Chapter identifier (key in Theme.chapters object)

code_references.usage: TypeScript type definition - optional display name (fallback to id)

notes: Optional display name for chapter. Falls back to chapter id if not provided.
Optional description field. Not present in JSON structure.

code_references.usage: TypeScript type definition - optional background image

notes: Optional background image filename. Currently not actively used in rendering.

code_references.usage: Background rendering during gameplay - renderGradientBackground(), parallax layers
Editor UI - GradientPicker component for editing
Galaxy Map - moon chapter background gradient

notes: Array of 2+ hex colors. First color used for main background, second for parallax layer.
Flexible JSONB field for additional chapter metadata. Currently not actively used.

code_references.usage: TypeScript type definition - required spawnRate field
Editor UI - input field for spawn rate (0.1-5.0)
Default value when creating new chapter (1.0)

notes: Objects per second for this chapter. Required field in JSON. Typical range: 1.0-3.0. Maps to gameplay spawn rate.

code_references.usage: TypeScript type definition - optional music filename

notes: Optional music filename for chapter-specific background music. Falls back to theme/universe music if not set.

code_references.usage: TypeScript type definition - optional particle effect name

notes: Optional particle effect name for chapter-specific visual effects. Falls back to theme/universe particle effect.

Auto-generated timestamp when record is updated
Auto-generated UUID for database relationships
Backup field during migration, may be removed later
Foreign key linking chapter to theme
Foreign key to rounds.id (e.g., 'F10_012', 'BR_IT_001')
Type discriminator: 'base', 'correct', or 'distractor'
Required collection sequence (1, 2, 3, ...). null = no order required. Used in Lernmodus only.
Text to display. Either word or image must be present.
Category/type for metadata (e.g., 'Symptom', 'Wrong', 'BrainrotTerm')
Optional image filename. Either word or image must be present.
Explanation text shown after collection/destruction. Required for correct/distractor items.

code_references.usage: Type definition - movement behavior for distractors

notes: Movement pattern for distractor items: 'linear_inward', 'seek_center', 'zigzag', 'wave'

code_references.usage: Type definition - damage dealt on collision

notes: Damage dealt to Ship on collision (1 = light, 2 = medium, 3 = heavy)
Correct category hint shown when distractor is hit (e.g., 'Schizophrenie')
Horizontal spawn location (0.0-1.0). 0.5 = center, 0.0 = left, 1.0 = right.
Random variance around spawnPosition (typically 0.05 = Â±5%)

code_references.usage: Type definition - optional delay in seconds

notes: Optional delay in seconds from round start before spawning
Speed multiplier (typically 0.9 for correct, 1.1-1.2 for distractors)
Points awarded when collected (correct) or destroyed (distractor)
Hit points (default: 1). Objects with HP > 1 require multiple hits.
Optional sound effect filename (e.g., 'bubble_hit_soft', 'explosion_minor')
Hex color code. In Lernmodus: overridden to green (#00ff88) for correct, red (#ff3333) for distractors.
Shape variant: 'hexagon', 'star', 'bubble', 'spike', 'square', 'diamond'
Whether item has pulsation animation
Font size multiplier (typically 1.0-1.2)

code_references.usage: TypeScript type definition - visual tier level
Font size calculation based on tier (not directly used, but part of visual config)
Example JSON - tier: 2 for base items

notes: Visual tier level for base items (typically 1-3). Higher tier = more prominent display.

code_references.usage: TypeScript type definition - visual size multiplier
Data population - size calculated based on word length (0.6-1.5 range)

notes: Visual size multiplier for base items. Typically 0.6-1.5. Calculated based on word length: shorter words = larger size.

code_references.usage: TypeScript type definition - visual appearance style
Example JSON - appearance: 'bold' for base items

notes: Visual appearance style for base items. Values: 'bold', 'italic', 'normal'. Used for font styling.

code_references.usage: Example JSON - glow: true for base items

notes: Whether base item has glow effect. Creates pulsing glow animation around the word.

code_references.usage: Shake offset calculation for distractor items
Example JSON - shake: false for distractors

notes: Whether item has shake animation. Mainly used for distractor items to draw attention. Creates horizontal shake effect.

code_references.usage: TypeScript type definition - movement pattern for correct items
Movement behavior switch: linear_inward, zigzag, wave, seek_center
Example JSON - pattern: 'linear_inward' for correct items

notes: Movement pattern for correct items. Values: 'linear_inward' (default), 'zigzag', 'wave', 'seek_center'. Note: behavior is for distractors, pattern is for correct items.
